text: Gopas or Gwala are a tribe or caste of Bombay (now Mumbai), IndiaThe tribes and castes of Bombay Volume 1 By Reginald Edward Enthoven, and in Bihar who were kinsmen and fighters for Vasudeva Krishna. They are known as Yadav in Northern India. They were allied with Kauravas, due to a pact made between Vasudeva Krishna, Arjuna and Duryodhana. They are division of the Yadav/Ahir community. The pact of Vasudeva Krishna to Arjuna and Duryodhana:- There is a large body of cowherds known as the Narayanas, all of whom are able to fight in the thick of battle. These soldiers shall be sent to one of you and I alone, resolved not to fight on the field, and laying down my weapons, will go to the other. Arjuna selected Vasudeva Krishna and Duryodhana selected Krishna's army. (5,7) Many thousands of Gopas with a large Gopayana force battled in the Kurukshetra War, at Kauravas side, against the Pandavas, along with other armies, like the Madras, the Sauviras, the Gandharas, the Trigartas and the Kalingas. (6,71) Lord Krishna was a Gopa. Amarakosha gives Ballava as well as Abhira as synonym for Gopa. In Harivamsa Purana, it has been said that Gopa/Gopas and Yadav are generic of the same lineage.The cattle and the stick: an ethnographic profile of the Raut of Chhattisgarh Gopa or Gopas are found mainly in Bihar, and also in Jharkhand and West Bengal, Maharshtra, Uttar Pradesh. According to Rigveda, the word Gopa is derived from cow. ==References== Category:Hindu mythology Yadav Category:Hindu communities Category:Social groups of Bihar Category:Social groups of Haryana Category:Social groups of West Bengal Category:Social groups of Maharashtra Category:Social groups of Chhattisgarh Category:Social groups of Uttar Pradesh
